name: Lateral floodplain inundation
functionStatement: Frequent overbank flows reduce flood peaks, support riparian vegetation, create off-channel refugia, and extend nutrient processing time.
descriptionMarkdown: 1-2 yr floods routinely access the floodplain, matching reference inundation patterns.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Map bankfull inundation extent using a DEM and bankfull flow estimate and compare to mapped floodplain layers as a proxy for moderate-flood access.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: No inundation until very large floods because of levees and incision.
Criteria: Only extreme events produce inundation.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Little inundation until ~Q10. Backwaters remain dry in moderate events.
Criteria: ~10 year event needed for access.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Inundation begins near ~Q3-Q5 with patchy coverage.
Criteria: 3-5 year floods required for broad access.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: HEC-RAS 2D shows the floodplain and backwaters inundate at ~Q2 with 0.3-0.6 m depths.
Criteria: 1-2 year floods inundate side and backwaters.
